No new all-time highs in 2026. XRPUSDT grew 1,175% between late 2024 through 2025. That's it! the market needs to go through a full reset before the appearance of a new bull market. We are bullish now though.

If you hold one of those LONG positions, you need to update your "TP" (take profits) targets. No higher highs, no new all-time highs. This project already went through a bull market in 2025.

Those that grew in 2025, are very likely to do poorly in 2026. Those that did poorly in 2025, are likely to do great in 2026. A repeat of the same dynamic we had in 2024-2025.

Many projects did great in 2024, producing a full blown bull market. These same projects did poorly in 2025. Many projects did bad in 2024 and this performed nicely in 2025.

XRPUSDT is showing bullish potential but this is likely to be only a relief rally. A relief rally can be weak or strong but a new all-time high is out of the question. See the chart. Plenty of resistance is present all across. We have higher highs but also lower lows.

In truth, the XRP chart is mixed, but the recent 1,175% bullish cycle gives it away. After such strong growth, there can be a long period before a new bullish phase.

This is just a friendly reminder. Sell those trading high to buy those trading low.

When the next resistance zone is activated, we will be tracking the market for amazing SHORTs.

$XRP Isn‚Äôt Just a Token. It‚Äôs a Question.


What if the real innovation in crypto isn‚Äôt about getting rich faster‚Ä¶
‚Ä¶but about moving value as freely as information?


XRP challenges a quiet assumption most people no longer question:
That money has to be slow, expensive, fragmented, and gatekept.


For decades, we accepted a system where:
	‚Ä¢	Cross-border payments take days
	‚Ä¢	Middlemen extract invisible fees
	‚Ä¢	Billions of people remain underbanked
	‚Ä¢	‚ÄúGlobal‚Äù finance is anything but global


XRP asks something uncomfortable:
What if this inefficiency isn‚Äôt a technical problem‚Ä¶ but a legacy one?


Love it or hate it, XRP sits at the intersection of:
	‚Ä¢	Regulation vs. decentralization
	‚Ä¢	Institutions vs. individuals
	‚Ä¢	Old financial rails vs. internet-speed value


It‚Äôs not trying to replace money overnight.
It‚Äôs trying to make money move like it belongs in the digital age.


And maybe that‚Äôs why XRP sparks such strong reactions.
Because it forces us to confront a deeper question:


üëâ Are we here to rebuild the system‚Ä¶ or just to profit from its cracks?


Whether you‚Äôre holding XRP, watching from the sidelines, or actively skeptical‚Äî
your perspective matters in this conversation.


So here‚Äôs the real question:
Do you think the future of crypto is about escaping the financial system‚Ä¶
or upgrading it?


Agree, disagree, challenge the idea‚Äîbut don‚Äôt sleep on this.


The future of value won‚Äôt be decided in silence.

A major institutional player in global finance has made its position on XRP clear, placing the cryptocurrency at the center of its digital asset strategy. Franklin Templeton, an asset management firm handling over $1.6 trillion worth of assets, used a recent post on the social media platform X to explain why it is going deep into XRP as an asset, while also drawing attention to its Spot exchange-traded product, XRPZ. This interesting comment is part of a growing institutional confidence in XRP and the XRP Ledger.

Franklin Templeton‚Äôs Strategic Entry With A Spot XRP ETF

Franklin Templeton‚Äôs arrival in the XRP ETF space is one of the most significant endorsements of the token from a legacy financial institution. The firm launched the Franklin XRP Trust, trading under ticker XRPZ on the NYSE Arca in late November, offering investors regulated exposure to the digital asset without the operational complexity of holding the token directly. 

The fund is structured as a grantor trust that holds XRP and calculates its net asset value daily based on established reference rates, with custody provided by Coinbase Custody Trust Company and administration by BNY Mellon. 

Recent comments from leading voices at the fund manager reveal that the decision to launch a Spot XRP ETF is due to their strong belief in XRP and the XRP Ledger. Roger Bayston, Head of Digital Assets at Franklin Templeton, highlighted the XRP Ledger‚Äôs designed capability for real-time, low-cost settlement and efficient cross-border payments. 

Furthermore, he noted that the altcoin‚Äôs market capitalization and role in global value transfer make it an important component worth regulated exposure for investors with a broad portfolio. The firm‚Äôs broader digital asset suite already includes Bitcoin and Ethereum ETFs, and XRP was the latest to join this year.
